10require "digest/md5"
11require "active_support/core_ext/marshal"
12require "active_support/core_ext/array/extract_options"
13
14module ActiveSupport
15 module Cache
16 # A cache store implementation which stores data in Memcached:
17 # https://memcached.org
18 #
19 # This is currently the most popular cache store for production websites.
20 #
21 # Special features:
22 # - Clustering and load balancing. One can specify multiple memcached servers,
23 # and MemCacheStore will load balance between all available servers. If a
24 # server goes down, then MemCacheStore will ignore it until it comes back up.
25 #
26 # MemCacheStore implements the Strategy::LocalCache strategy which implements
27 # an in-memory cache inside of a block.
28 class MemCacheStore < Store
29 # Provide support for raw values in the local cache strategy.
30 module LocalCacheWithRaw # :nodoc:
31 private
32 def read_entry(key, options)
33 entry = super
34 if options[:raw] && local_cache && entry
35 entry = deserialize_entry(entry.value)
36 end
37 entry
38 end
39
40 def write_entry(key, entry, options)
41 if options[:raw] && local_cache
42 raw_entry = Entry.new(entry.value.to_s)
43 raw_entry.expires_at = entry.expires_at
44 super(key, raw_entry, options)
45 else
46 super
47 end
48 end
49 end
50
51 prepend Strategy::LocalCache
52 prepend LocalCacheWithRaw
53
54 ESCAPE_KEY_CHARS = /[\x00-\x20%\x7F-\xFF]/n
55
56 # Creates a new Dalli::Client instance with specified addresses and options.
57 # By default address is equal localhost:11211.
58 #
59 # ActiveSupport::Cache::MemCacheStore.build_mem_cache
60 # # => #<Dalli::Client:0x007f98a47d2028 @servers=["localhost:11211"], @options={}, @ring=nil>
61 # ActiveSupport::Cache::MemCacheStore.build_mem_cache('localhost:10290')
62 # # => #<Dalli::Client:0x007f98a47b3a60 @servers=["localhost:10290"], @options={}, @ring=nil>
63 def self.build_mem_cache(*addresses) # :nodoc:
64 addresses = addresses.flatten
65 options = addresses.extract_options!
66 addresses = ["localhost:11211"] if addresses.empty?
67 Dalli::Client.new(addresses, options)
68 end
69
70 # Creates a new MemCacheStore object, with the given memcached server
71 # addresses. Each address is either a host name, or a host-with-port string
72 # in the form of "host_name:port". For example:
73 #
74 # ActiveSupport::Cache::MemCacheStore.new("localhost", "server-downstairs.localnetwork:8229")
75 #
76 # If no addresses are specified, then MemCacheStore will connect to
77 # localhost port 11211 (the default memcached port).
78 def initialize(*addresses)
79 addresses = addresses.flatten
80 options = addresses.extract_options!
81 super(options)
82
83 unless [String, Dalli::Client, NilClass].include?(addresses.first.class)
84 raise ArgumentError, "First argument must be an empty array, an array of hosts or a Dalli::Client instance."
85 end
86 if addresses.first.is_a?(Dalli::Client)
87 @data = addresses.first
88 else
89 mem_cache_options = options.dup
90 UNIVERSAL_OPTIONS.each { |name| mem_cache_options.delete(name) }
91 @data = self.class.build_mem_cache(*(addresses + [mem_cache_options]))
92 end
93 end
94
95 # Reads multiple values from the cache using a single call to the
96 # servers for all keys. Options can be passed in the last argument.
97 def read_multi(*names)
98 options = names.extract_options!
99 options = merged_options(options)
100
101 keys_to_names = Hash[names.map { |name| [normalize_key(name, options), name] }]
102
103 raw_values = @data.get_multi(keys_to_names.keys)
104 values = {}
105
106 raw_values.each do |key, value|
107 entry = deserialize_entry(value)
108
109 unless entry.expired? || entry.mismatched?(normalize_version(keys_to_names[key], options))
110 values[keys_to_names[key]] = entry.value
111 end
112 end
113
114 values
115 end
116
117 # Increment a cached value. This method uses the memcached incr atomic
118 # operator and can only be used on values written with the :raw option.
119 # Calling it on a value not stored with :raw will initialize that value
120 # to zero.
121 def increment(name, amount = 1, options = nil)
122 options = merged_options(options)
123 instrument(:increment, name, amount: amount) do
124 rescue_error_with nil do
125 @data.incr(normalize_key(name, options), amount, options[:expires_in])
126 end
127 end
128 end
129
130 # Decrement a cached value. This method uses the memcached decr atomic
131 # operator and can only be used on values written with the :raw option.
132 # Calling it on a value not stored with :raw will initialize that value
133 # to zero.
134 def decrement(name, amount = 1, options = nil)
135 options = merged_options(options)
136 instrument(:decrement, name, amount: amount) do
137 rescue_error_with nil do
138 @data.decr(normalize_key(name, options), amount, options[:expires_in])
139 end
140 end
141 end
142
143 # Clear the entire cache on all memcached servers. This method should
144 # be used with care when shared cache is being used.
145 def clear(options = nil)
146 rescue_error_with(nil) { @data.flush_all }
147 end
148
149 # Get the statistics from the memcached servers.
150 def stats
151 @data.stats
152 end
153
154 private
155 # Read an entry from the cache.
156 def read_entry(key, options)
157 rescue_error_with(nil) { deserialize_entry(@data.get(key, options)) }
158 end
159
160 # Write an entry to the cache.
161 def write_entry(key, entry, options)
162 method = options && options[:unless_exist] ? :add : :set
163 value = options[:raw] ? entry.value.to_s : entry
164 expires_in = options[:expires_in].to_i
165 if expires_in > 0 && !options[:raw]
166 # Set the memcache expire a few minutes in the future to support race condition ttls on read
167 expires_in += 5.minutes
168 end
169 rescue_error_with false do
170 @data.send(method, key, value, expires_in, options)
171 end
172 end
173
174 # Delete an entry from the cache.
175 def delete_entry(key, options)
176 rescue_error_with(false) { @data.delete(key) }
177 end
178
179 # Memcache keys are binaries. So we need to force their encoding to binary
180 # before applying the regular expression to ensure we are escaping all
181 # characters properly.
182 def normalize_key(key, options)
183 key = super.dup
184 key = key.force_encoding(Encoding::ASCII_8BIT)
185 key = key.gsub(ESCAPE_KEY_CHARS) { |match| "%#{match.getbyte(0).to_s(16).upcase}" }
186 key = "#{key[0, 213]}:md5:#{Digest::MD5.hexdigest(key)}" if key.size > 250
187 key
188 end
189
190 def deserialize_entry(raw_value)
191 if raw_value
192 entry = Marshal.load(raw_value) rescue raw_value
193 entry.is_a?(Entry) ? entry : Entry.new(entry)
194 end
195 end
196
197 def rescue_error_with(fallback)
198 yield
199 rescue Dalli::DalliError => e
200 logger.error("DalliError (#{e}): #{e.message}") if logger
201 fallback
202 end
203 end
204 end
205end
